text: What are some people's favorite webhosting platforms for making a personal website/blog with the intent of showcasing some code examples?

elements.text: What are some people's favorite webhosting platforms for making a personal website/blog with the intent of showcasing some code examples?

text: I'd recommend Netlify (it's what I use), or GH Pages. If you want your code samples to be interactive and existing SSGs can't handle it you might need to look elsewhere though

elements.text: I'd recommend Netlify (it's what I use), or GH Pages. If you want your code samples to be interactive and existing SSGs can't handle it you might need to look elsewhere though

text: Thanks :slightly_smiling_face: of course I wondered if there already was a julia solution to this and low and behold there is an SSG: <https://github.com/tlienart/Franklin.jl>

text: I use GH Pages with hugo (<https://gohugo.io/>)

text:
I use Jekyll and I hate it.
But time spent migriating my blog to a new platform is a waste of time that could be better spent writing a new blog post

text: Hugo does the job but feels more and more bloated. Franklin is a really nice take on SSG

text:
> Hugo [...] feels more and more bloated
Hugo targets a lot more than just blogs, so that kinda makes sense. I use  a pretty tiny subset of it.

elements.text: Hugo [...] feels more and more bloated

text: yes I definitely agree, Hugo targets more but even understanding the changes from one version to the next and navigating the doc becomes tough, took me a while to understand why my table of contents for all posts were done after upgrading

text: There was a funny xkcd-style post on HN a few months ago about the relation between the level of complication in a blog setup and number of posts about said setup. Anyone remember it?
